components.name: hbfwjj
components.content:
We need to ask some questions to check you can apply for this funding.

We’ll ask about whether:

  • your organisation is based in the UK
  • your organisation meets all the eligibility criteria listed in the associated prospectus
  • you are able to commence and deliver the project within the timescales set out in the prospectus
  • within the past 5 years your organisation, or any person who has powers of representation, decision or control within the organisation, has been convicted anywhere in the world of participation in the listed offences

pages.title: Is your organisation based in the UK?

components.name: hGHwKQ
components.title: Is your organisation based in the UK?

pages.title: You cannot apply for this funding

components.name: GsadSg
components.content:
You’re not eligible to apply for funding because your organisation is not based in the UK.

If you need help, email fundingservicesupport@communities.gov.uk

pages.title: Does your organisation meet all the eligibility criteria listed in the associated prospectus?

components.name: Xxpnic
components.content:
The organisation must:

  • be established for charitable, benevolent, or philanthropic purposes (see list of eligible organisations)
  • have a governing body with at least 3 members
  • have a governing document they can produce
  • have capacity to deliver an expected minimum of 125 sponsorship arrangements. Submissions below this number may be unsuccessful should minimum requirements be satisfactorily provided by other Principal Sponsors
  • set out the minimum and maximum (between 125 and 500 sponsor arrangements) number that will be financially viable

The £4.145 million will be divided by the number of sponsor arrangements a Principal Sponsor and MHCLG agree they will deliver.


Eligible organisations
‘Charity’ – A registered charity with a UK charity number or a registered CIC (community interest company). 

‘Community group’ – A group which meets all the following criteria: 
  • established for charitable, benevolent or philanthropic purposes
    •  
  • has a governing body with at least three members
    •  
  • has a governing document which they are able to produce
    •  
  • can provide accounts for the last two financial years
 
‘Community Interest Company’ - a special type of limited company which exists to benefit the community rather than private shareholders. 

‘Social enterprise’ - a business with primarily social objectives whose surpluses are principally reinvested for that purpose in the business or in the community, rather than being driven by the need to maximise profit for shareholders and owners.   Other voluntary and community organisations. 

‘Consortium’ – a group of applicants, with a designated lead partner to manage the scheme, and a system for dividing the work and funds appropriately and effectively. The lead partner must be a charity or a community group with a charitable purpose.  

Organisations must be based in the United Kingdom and provide an offer that can cover England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland.

components.name: FYihtz
components.title: Does your organisation meet all the eligibility criteria listed in the associated prospectus?

pages.title: You cannot apply for this funding

components.name: PgOIyb
components.content:
You’re not eligible to apply for funding because your organisation does not meet all the eligibility criteria listed in the associated prospectus.

If you need help, email fundingservicesupport@communities.gov.uk

pages.title: Are you able to commence and deliver the project within the timescales set out in the prospectus?

components.name: tleoMC
components.content: We expect projects to begin delivery in August 2025. Delivery of your project must be completed by 31 March 2031.

components.name: AjjCOG
components.title: Are you able to commence and deliver the project within the timescales set out in the prospectus?

pages.title: You cannot apply for this funding

components.name: UVzSCg
components.content:
You’re not eligible to apply for funding because you are not able to commence and deliver the project within the timescales set out in the prospectus.

If you need help, email fundingservicesupport@communities.gov.uk

pages.title: Within the past 5 years, has your organisation, or any person who has powers of representation, decision or control within the organisation, been convicted anywhere in the world of the offences listed?

components.name: oPOxPZ
components.content:
Offences include:

  • corruption
  • fraud
  • money laundering or terrorist financing
  • participation in a criminal organisation
  • terrorist offences or links to terrorist activity

components.name: FMCXyx
components.title: Within the past 5 years, has your organisation, or any person who has powers of representation, decision or control within the organisation, been convicted anywhere in the world of the offences listed?

pages.title: You cannot apply for this funding

components.name: zQPERd
components.content:
You’re not eligible to apply for funding because within the past 5 years, your organisation, or any person who has powers of representation, decision or control within the organisation, has been convicted anywhere in the world of the offences listed.

Offences include:

  • corruption
  • fraud
  • money laundering or terrorist financing
  • participation in a criminal organisation
  • terrorist offences or links to terrorist activity

If you need help, email fundingservicesupport@communities.gov.uk
